title: Metadata-Driven Instructional Design for Extracting Digital Learning Objects

context.prior_knowledge: Digital instructional material development and basic understanding of instructional design theories
context.additional_context: A large-scale teacher training program conducted in a smartphone-based limited technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can systematically extract learning objects from various digital materials (HTML, Word documents, etc.).
Learners can explain methods to restructure extracted learning objects into educational resources by applying metadata.
Team-based collaboration in mobile environments enables the design and evaluation of language education learning modules.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
